title: Build's "Fourty Thousand One Hundred and Fiftyseven"
content:
I'm looking for this font used in one of Build's work...thanks ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081117203215im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/69646.jpg)

 [‹ (x) Herbs & spices - ITC Stone Sans {Yves}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081117203215/http:/www.typophile.com/node/10416 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) "The Problem of the Media" Robert McChesney book - Swift {Héctor} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081117203215/http:/www.typophile.com/node/10371 "Go to next forum topic")
author: kib820

comments.content:
anyone knows what it is??   
thanks
Not yet, but I don't have time right now to investigate. Sorry. ![:-(](http://web.archive.org/web/20081117203215im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/sad.gif)

Michael C Place _( [Build](http://web.archive.org/web/20081117203215/http:/www.designbybuild.com/), former [tDR](http://web.archive.org/web/20081117203215/http:/www.thedesignersrepublic.com/) )_ additionally designed his own fonts in the past, so this may as well be one of his own, custom ones..
A gutsy alternative with interesting ink trap motifs is YouWorkForThem's [Enam](http://web.archive.org/web/20081117203215/http:/youworkforthem.com/product.php?sku=T0026)

Some more in similiar style:   
 [Tryptomene](http://web.archive.org/web/20081117203215/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/testpilot/tryptomene/regular/)   
 [Trapper](http://web.archive.org/web/20081117203215/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/typeco/trapper/round-bold/)   
 [Phuture](http://web.archive.org/web/20081117203215/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/t26/phuture-odc/ultra-regular/)   
   
It also might be possible that the typeface is thin, but added with round-edged stroking.
